description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDING AND ERECTION OF 3 x 3 BED TERRACED HOUSES. ASSOCIATED LANDSCAPING AND CREATION OF AMENITY AREAS, PARKING AND CYCLE STORAGE
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - In the absence of a completed S106 undertaking to ensure that 2 of the 3 dwellings are prevented from being able to obtain parking permits for the Controlled Parking Zone, the proposal would result in an increased demand for on street parking, resulting in a detrimental impact on highway and additional parking pressure locally, and be contrary to the Mayor and the Council's commitment to reducing car usage and promoting more sustainable forms of transport. It would also prevent the Council recouping money spent to modify the Traffic Management Order. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021, policy DM T1, DM T2 and DM T3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy CS20 of the Core Planning Strategy 2011.In the absence of a completed S106 undertaking to ensure that 2 of the 3 dwellings are prevented from being able to obtain parking permits for the Controlled Parking Zone, the proposal would result in an increased demand for on street parking, resulting in a detrimental impact on highway and additional parking pressure locally, and be contrary to the Mayor and the Council's commitment to reducing car usage and promoting more sustainable forms of transport. It would also prevent the Council recouping money spent to modify the Traffic Management Order. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021, policy DM T1, DM T2 and DM T3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy CS20 of the Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Reason : 2 - In the absence of a completed S106 undertaking to ensure that in the event that the development proposed under ref:20/P3757 is implemented that permission ref:19/P1298 is not implemented. The proposal has the potential to result in harm to the street scene, contrary to Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 policy DM D1, DM D2 and DMD3, Core Strategy Policy CS 14, and London Plan 2021 policy D2, D3 and D4.

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE 1 - Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, because the applicant has failed to enter into a S106 agreement, neccessary to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
